javadoc: A class to represent the start or end tag from an XML file.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this element represents a start tag.
@return true if this element represents a start tag
methods.name: isStart
methods.comment: Returns true if this element represents a start tag.

return.comment: true if this element represents a start tag

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this element represents an end tag.
@return true if this element represents an end tag
methods.name: isEnd
methods.comment: Returns true if this element represents an end tag.

return.comment: true if this element represents an end tag

methods.javadoc:
Returns the name of this element/tag.
@return the name of this element/tag
methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Returns the name of this element/tag.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the line number where this element was defined.
@return the line number where this element was defined
methods.name: getLineNum
methods.comment: Returns the line number where this element was defined.

return.comment: the line number where this element was defined

methods.name: getText
methods.comment:
Returns the text of this element. Or, null if no text existed
 in the XML.

methods.name: getAttrValue
methods.comment:
Returns the value of the specified attribute.
 Or, null if no attribute exists with the specified name.

return.comment: the value of the specified attribute

methods.name: getAttrValueAsBool
methods.comment: Returns the boolean value of the specified attribute.

return.comment: the boolean value of the specified attribute

methods.name: getAttrValueAsInt
methods.comment: Returns the integer value of the specified attribute.

return.comment: the integer value of the specified attribute

methods.name: getAttrValueAsLong
methods.comment: Returns the long value of the specified attribute.

return.comment: the long value of the specified attribute

methods.name: getAttrValueAsDouble
methods.comment: Returns the double value of the specified attribute.

return.comment: the double value of the specified attribute

methods.javadoc:
Returns an array containing the names of all attributes defined in this element.
@return an array containing the names of all attributes defined in this element
methods.name: getAttrNames
methods.comment: Returns an array containing the names of all attributes defined in this element.

return.comment: an array containing the names of all attributes defined in this element

methods.name: hasAttr
methods.comment: Returns true if this element contains an attribute with the specified name.

return.comment: true if this element contains an attribute with the specified name

methods.name: setAttribute
methods.comment: Sets the value of the specified attribute.

name: XmlParserElement
comment: A class to represent the start or end tag from an XML file.
